# List of presidents of the Marshall Islands__disambig_1

| insignia                = Seal of the Marshall Islands.svg
| insigniasize            = 125px
| insigniacaption         = Seal of Government ofthe Republic of the Marshall Islands
| termlength              = Four years,
| termlength_qualified    = renewable once
| constituting_instrument = Constitution of the Marshall Islands
| image                   = File:President of the Marshall Islands Hilda Cathy Heine.jpg
| incumbent               = Hilda Heine
| incumbentsince          = 3 January 2024
| formation               =
| salary                  = US$60,000 annually
| inaugural               = Amata Kabua
| deputy                  = Minister in Assistance to the President of Marshall Islands
| website                 =
}}
The president of the Republic of the Marshall Islands is the head of state and head of government of the Marshall Islands. The President is elected by the Nitijeļā (Legislature) from among its members. Presidents pick cabinet members from the Nitijeļā.
Amata Kabua was elected as the first President of the Republic in 1979.  Subsequently, he was re-elected to four-year terms in 1983, 1987, 1991, and 1996.  After Amata Kabua's death in office, his first cousin, Imata Kabua, won a special election in 1997. Casten Nemra, who was elected and took office in January 2016, was replaced by Hilda Heine one week later. The Marshallese president, David Kabua, is the son of Amata Kabua. The current Marshallese president is Hilda Heine.
